definition: one that is of equal standing with another : equal, one belonging to the same societal group especially based on age, grade, or status
examples: The band mates welcomed the new member as a peer.
teenagers spending time with their peers

definition: a member of one of the five ranks (duke, marquess, earl, viscount, or baron) of the British peerage

examples: Peers and commoners alike were shown the same courtesy.

definition: to look narrowly or curiously, to look searchingly at something difficult to discern
examples: a child peering from behind a tree
She peered into the dark closet looking for her missing shoe.

definition: to come slightly into view : emerge partly
examples: a vast white cloud, through which the sun peered
